Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Chensinin-1b (C1b, UCLL1; Chensinin-1 analog, Arg-rich; synthetic AMPs20; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, amphibians, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (60.11%) toChensinin-1R: 28%; H: 22%; W: 17%.  GRAVY: -1.67; M Wt: 2551.955; Mol formula: C119H174N45O20; molar extinction coeff: 16650 (3W).Activity: active against S. aureus (MIC 3.13 uM), S. epidermidis MRSE1208 (MIC 12.5 uM), B. cereus (MIC 3.13 uM), S. lactis (MIC 3.13 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 1.56 uM), E. faecium (MIC 3.13 uM), E. coli (MIC 6.25 uM), E-cloacae (MIC >50 uM), P-fluorescens MRPF0322 (MIC >50 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 1.56 uM). It can neutralize LPS and reducing inflammation (Li et al., 2023).Structure: helix feature observed in the structure.Animal model:mouse: Chensinin-1b produced a significant improvement in wound healing in mice when compared with mupirocin ointment.MOA:bacteria: membrane disruption. MOA:cancer: membrane damage (Guo et al., 2022). Replaced 8/2023
Literature Information.Author: Dong W, Dong Z, Mao X, Sun Y, Li F, Shang D.2016
Literature Information.Title: Structure-activity analysis and biological studies of chensinin-1b analogues.
